Comments_List: Great discussions on contemporary European politics and how we should make sense of the current environment
Electoral systems, theories about party formation, immigration and other subjects of variation among European states.
Greater knowledge of the scholarship of European politics.
Professor Cameron asks very good questions that have always sparked great and lively discussions. Overall, the course is excellent.
The discussions and weekly commentary were the strengths of the course. It had no weaknesses.

I really enjoyed all the books we covered, though in some cases extracts from several books rather than the whole of one book might have helped give a broad perspective on the week's topic. I felt the topics were really well chosen, and spanned big issues facing European countries. I also liked that the writing load was divided over the whole course.
Yes, certainly to everyone wanting to know more about contemporary Europe.
Yes, this course was very informative.
